text.headline: The First Artificial Neuron
text.text: Warren McCulloch and Walter Pitts present a mathematical model of biological neurons. This proved that simple networked units could perform logic functions, laying the groundwork for neural networks.

media.caption: Warren McCulloch, pioneer of neural modeling.

text.headline: The Turing Test
text.text: Alan Turing proposes a test for machine intelligence: if a machine can fool a human into thinking it is human during conversation, it possesses intelligence.

text.headline: The Term 'Artificial Intelligence'
text.text: John McCarthy coins the term 'Artificial Intelligence' at the Dartmouth Workshop, officially launching the field as a dedicated branch of science and engineering.

text.headline: Unimate: The First Industrial Robot
text.text: General Motors installs the Unimate robotic arm to replace humans in dangerous assembly tasks, marking the birth of industrial robotics.

media.caption: Unimate on the GM assembly line.

text.headline: ELIZA: Natural Language Processing
text.text: Joseph Weizenbaum develops ELIZA, the first program capable of simulating human conversation via a 'psychotherapist' script.

media.caption: A screenshot of an ELIZA conversation.

text.headline: Shakey the Robot
text.text: The first general-purpose mobile robot capable of reasoning about its own actions and navigating its environment.

media.caption: Shakey at the Computer History Museum.

text.headline: The AI Winter
text.text: A period of reduced funding and interest in AI research after several high-profile projects failed to meet over-ambitious expectations.

media.caption: Symbolic representation of the stagnation in AI funding.

text.headline: Deep Blue Defeats Kasparov
text.text: IBM's Deep Blue beats world chess champion Garry Kasparov, proving that machines can master highly complex strategic logic.

text.headline: Roomba: AI in the Home
text.text: iRobot launches the Roomba, the first mass-produced robotic vacuum, capable of navigating and cleaning the home without human intervention.

text.headline: Siri and Watson
text.text: Apple integrates Siri into the iPhone 4S, while IBM's Watson wins Jeopardy!, demonstrating incredible progress in natural language understanding.

text.headline: Eugene Passes the Turing Test
text.text: The Eugene Goostman chatbot convinces 33% of judges that it is a human, the first program to meet the Turing Test's numerical criteria.

media.caption: Representing the breakthrough in computer-human mimicry.

text.headline: AlphaGo Beats Lee Sedol
text.text: DeepMind's AlphaGo defeats a world champion in the game of Go, which is far more complex than chess, using deep neural networks.

text.headline: OpenAI Launches ChatGPT
text.text: The public release of ChatGPT brings generative AI into the mainstream, capable of nuanced conversation, coding, and creative writing.
